result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomasion C Seay in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Thomasion C Seay. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Do not drive at all. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
*Amended 03-24-22 May have GPS exception to go to work with verification through pretrial services.

Defense has filed a bond motion at 8:22 am. Requesting a lower cash bond.
State has not had enough notice to review the motion based on when it was filed, based on current file and the risk to the community state objects.
Defense gives further argument.
BTC: Motion to modify bond is granted to a $1000 cash bond with GPS monitoring.
